dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so, we've got Congress scrambling, right? Like, eleven days left before recess, trying to get this fifth stimulus package done. But, uh, there's a pretty wild report out there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so, we've got Congress scrambling, right? Like, eleven days left before recess, trying to get this fifth stimulus package done. But, uh, there's a pretty wild report out there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Congress is readying for a frantic push to come together on a fifth coronavirus stimulus package with just 11 days to act before lawmakers break for August recess and as the U.S. continues to break records for new daily cases.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, I saw that. You mean about the White House trying to cut funding?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, I saw that. You mean about the White House trying to cut funding?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! The Washington Post is reporting that the Trump administration is actively trying to block billions in federal funding for, get this, *testing* and the CDC.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! The Washington Post is reporting that the Trump administration is actively trying to block billions in federal funding for, get this, testing and the C D C.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As Congress races to come together on a fifth coronavirus stimulus package with cases skyrocketing across the country, the Trump administration is actively working to block billions of dollars in federal funding for testing and the Centers for Disease Control, according to a new report from the Washington Post.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, testing? And the CDC? I mean, with cases skyrocketing, that just seems... counterintuitive, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, testing? And the C D C? I mean, with cases skyrocketing, that just seems... counterintuitive, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. And it's not just testing, they're also apparently trying to reduce funding for the State Department and the Pentagon's pandemic efforts. It's wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. And it's not just testing, they're also apparently trying to reduce funding for the State Department and the Pentagon's pandemic efforts. It's wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Trump administration is also attempting to reduce funding in the GOP proposal for the State Department and the Pentagon to fight the pandemic, the Post reports.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. So, um, how are Republicans in Congress reacting to this, though? Because I know some of them have been pretty vocal about the need for testing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. So, um, how are Republicans in Congress reacting to this, though? Because I know some of them have been pretty vocal about the need for testing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: You're spot on. The Post says some GOP senators are actually pretty angered by this request and are pushing back hard, saying the funding *has* to stay.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You're spot on. The Post says some G O P senators are actually pretty angered by this request and are pushing back hard, saying the funding has to stay.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The White House request has reportedly angered GOP senators, and some Republicans have pushed back, adamant the funding should stay in the bill.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, that makes a bit more sense. But still, it's like, why is the administration doing this? Is it, like, a cost thing, or...?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, that makes a bit more sense. But still, it's like, why is the administration doing this? Is it, like, a cost thing, or...?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it ties into Trump's past comments, right? He's been, uh, pretty critical of the CDC, even disagreed with Redfield's mask guidance. And remember when he said he told officials to slow down testing?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it ties into Trump's past comments, right? He's been, uh, pretty critical of the C D C, even disagreed with Redfield's mask guidance. And remember when he said he told officials to slow down testing?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Post report comes as Trump continues to swipe at the CDC: on Friday, the president said he doesnt agree with the CDC director Robert Redfields mask guidance... Trump has called for the U.S. to scale back testing, going so far as to say during a rally in Tulsa, Oklahoma last month that he told officials to slow down testing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah! The Tulsa rally. He said it was a joke, but then he said he doesn't kid. [chuckles] Very confusing messaging there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah! The Tulsa rally. He said it was a joke, but then he said he doesn't kid. Very confusing messaging there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He later said he said the comment in jest, but then said he doesnt kid.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And, you know, some White House officials apparently think money approved for testing earlier is just... unspent. Which is another layer to this.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And, you know, some White House officials apparently think money approved for testing earlier is just... unspent. Which is another layer to this.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Post reports that some White House officials believe money approved for testing has been unspent (the coronavirus spending package passed in April included $25 billion for testing.)

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right. Meanwhile, we're seeing these huge backlogs at labs, like five to seven days for results. So, the testing problem is still very much real.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. Meanwhile, we're seeing these huge backlogs at labs, like five to seven days for results. So, the testing problem is still very much real.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This week, the Washington Post reported that some testing sites are taking five to seven days to deliver results to patients.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. Even Mick Mulvaney, former Chief of Staff, wrote an op-ed saying, 'we still have a testing problem in this country.' Which, uh, is pretty telling.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. Even Mick Mulvaney, former Chief of Staff, wrote an op-ed saying, 'we still have a testing problem in this country.' Which, uh, is pretty telling.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Former White House Chief of Staff Mick Mulvaney penned an op-ed in CNBC this week in which he argued the U.S. still has a testing problem. ... I know it isnt popular to talk about in some Republican circles, but we still have a testing problem in this country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's a significant voice to add to the chorus. So, what about the rest of the stimulus? Are they even close on, like, unemployment or stimulus checks?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's a significant voice to add to the chorus. So, what about the rest of the stimulus? Are they even close on, like, unemployment or stimulus checks?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Mixed messages there too, unfortunately. Mnuchin is pushing for another round of checks and extending some unemployment, but others in the admin are talking about payroll tax holidays. [interrupts] It's an 'epic clash,' as Fox Business put it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mixed messages there too, unfortunately. Mnuchin is pushing for another round of checks and extending some unemployment, but others in the admin are talking about payroll tax holidays. It's an 'epic clash,' as Fox Business put it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Trump administration has sent mixed messages about its priorities for a fifth package, part of an epic clash occurring in the White House, Fox Business reported this week. Treasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin is pressing for another round of stimulus checks and even extending some variation of the $600 expanded unemployment program in a next bill, while other administration officials want to work around the edges with proposals like a payroll tax holiday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Ugh. So, no clear path forward then, with, like, a week and a half left? This is going to be a nail-biter.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ugh. So, no clear path forward then, with, like, a week and a half left? This is going to be a nail-biter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and Schumer, the Senate Minority Leader, is already calling them out, saying, 'We haven't heard a peep from McConnell or the Republicans on any proposal' even though they've been asking for weeks.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and Schumer, the Senate Minority Leader, is already calling them out, saying, 'We haven't heard a peep from McConnell or the Republicans on any proposal' even though they've been asking for weeks.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We have not heard a peep from McConnell or the Republicans or the administration on any proposal, even though we've been asking for weeks and weeks and weeks, Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-N.Y.) said on a conference call Friday about the GOP stimulus bill, CNN reported.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. So, basically, a lot of internal disagreement, a lot of external pressure, and not a lot of time. This fifth stimulus is looking pretty messy, huh?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. So, basically, a lot of internal disagreement, a lot of external pressure, and not a lot of time. This fifth stimulus is looking pretty messy, huh?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Messy is an understatement, B. It's, uh, it's a real chaotic situation right now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Messy is an understatement, B. It's, uh, it's a real chaotic situation right now.
